> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Pat Farrell
> Sent: Freitag, 8. August 2008 02:10
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] Testing the exception
>
> > getResult has a exception at some statement which has already been
> > caught in the getResult itself. I want that the assertEquals should
> > catch the excepton.
> > what to do?
>
> I write code like this:
>
> boolean caughtOne = false;
> try {
> // do something that should throw
> } catch (Exception e) {
> caughtOne = true;
> }
>
> assertTrue(caughtOne);

Hi,

I think thats a bad practice. Better use:

try {
// exception throwing statement.
fail("NullPointerException expected!");
} catch (NullPointerException e) {
// optional asserts on the exception message or exception cause.
}

Other exceptions are thrown through, so the
test fails for all other nonexpected exceptions.

For JUnit4 instead use:

@Test(expected=NullPointerException.class)
public void testIsThrowingNullPointerException() {
// exception throwing statement.
}
